intro: Chorisochora chascanoides, commonly known as the Canary Island mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Chorisochora chascanoides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs.
